unit: Unit 8 | Inference for Categorical Data: Chi-Square
title: Plant Manager: Pairs of Hypotheses
question_text: A plant manager wants to see if there are different proportions of defective items among the four machines at her automotive plant. She randomly selects $100$ automobile parts from each of the four machines, as shown in the table below: Machine A B C D Number of Defective Parts 58 42 55 45 What are the best pair of hypotheses the plant manager could state?

choices.text: H 0 : H 0 : There is no association between machine type and defectiveness H a : H a : There is an association between machine type and defectiveness
